comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: Robert Morris Doyle Rear Admiral, United States Navy From 1911 to 1913 he was commandant of the Norfolk Navy Yard and from 1913 to 1915, Commander-in-Chief of the Pacific Reserve Fleet. www.arlingtoncemetery.net/rmdoyle.htm

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I suspect that Bain gathered photos of naval officers because of the US military actions in Tampico and Vera Cruz (Mexico) in early 1914.  Bios of several officers in this batch mention Vera Cruz.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The General News Notes of the Day section of Daily Racing Form on April 24, 1914 name.kdl.kyvl.org/drf1914042401 notes that he had been ordered to rendezvous his ships (the pacific fleet) at Mazatlan on the west coast of Mexico.
